adrFormatAddress: 385 6th Ave, New York, NY 10014-3516, USA

editorialSummary.text: Classic diner with vinyl booths open 24/7 offering a vast menu of American standards.

originalText.text:
This review is difficult for me, because I really thought it was going to be 5 starts all across by the way everything was going; until my & tasted the food(awful). Presentation really good üëç, quality, lack of flavor, toughness,and the list goes on to the point that we literally just packed all up. I personally felt that it was out outrageous the bill was almost $90. 2 kids meals, 1 waayyyy over cooked discussing, that is why I didn't continue to eat them cocktail shrimp, a cup of "soup" (more like porridge), and the appetizers sampler (that my kids who usually love that, didn't want).
We, left and turned right straight to Papayas Restaurant. They got some Hotdogs üå≠ combo's and hamburgers and said that it tastes better. I wanted to cry inside of me.

But, on the positive side of the restaurant. Our server, I wish I could have gotten his name, he was so nice and attentive, as matters of fact All the server. I felt welcomed, despite them being full and busy when first entered, and the bathroom is clean and spacious, also the ambitious is nice. A bit pricey, but keep in mind the area you are in as well.

originalText.text: Such a lovely little neighborhood diner, was the perfect breakfast for lunch kind of place with a large menu and a cozy vibe filled with locals I‚Äôd assume. No music which was actually nice after the constant noise of the city, very tasty food. Pancakes and egg/bacon/hashbrowns were the American classics I was looking for.

originalText.text:
A spotless Diner with extensive menu.
We had breakfast which was served in a hot pan, it was delicious. Originally from England, I was delighted the sausages were "real" sausages, and so good

We had breakfast which was served in a hot pan, it was delicious. Originally from England, I was delighted the sausages were "real" sausages, and so good

originalText.text: We were walking up 6th and saw the neon sign in the window: "Corned Beef & Pastrami" - well, doesn't take much more to get a new yorker's mouth watering. So gave it a try. It is a diner - hence my 5 rating for atmosphere. It was pretty much everything you expect. But the main reason we went in was the song of the neon. Growing up with Pastrami & Corned Beef heavens like Hobby's, Carnegie, 2nd Ave, & Katz's - the bar is almost unfairly high. But hey, you threw it out on neon! Not a lot of flavor, not very big, and overcooked. If we wanted breakfast, would definitely go back but the CB & P was disappointing. The onion rings on the other hand were excellent!

originalText.text: I have been a long time customer for years today I‚Äôm truly disappointed in this Ruben sandwich I ordered for lunch to take out  very sloppy made for  $22 chef please do not put the bread  under the sauerkraut, it made the bread really moist falling apart the sandwich wasn‚Äôt even put together couldn‚Äôt enjoy it.
